proto_err.errorCount – Error Counting¶

class proto_err.errorCount.counter(ref, errorList=None, samfile=None, opt=None)[source]¶

Takes a list of errors and does some kmer counting

Methods

countAlignedBases(read)[source]¶
countErrorKmer(maxKmerLength=None)[source]¶

Count all kmers in the list of errors of length kmerLen or below before and after and error.

Parameters:

maxKmerLength : int

This is a type. Maximum kmer length
Returns:

emmissionDic,beforeAfterCount :

dict,dict emmissionDic counts the number of times a transition occurs

e.g. {‘A’:{‘T’:123,’C’:123,...,},’T’:{‘A’:123,...},...}

emmissionDic[trueBase][emmitedBase] = count of trueBase -> emmitedBase transition

beforeAfterCount counts the number of times a kmer appears before or after an error

beforeAfterCount[‘before’][trueBase][emmitedBase][kmer] = count of kmer occurance before trueBase -> emmitedBase transition

beforeAfterCount[‘after’][trueBase][emmitedBase][kmer] = count of kmer occurance after trueBase -> emmitedBase transition

These dictonaries are also stored in the counter object in counter.res[‘errorMode’],counter.res[‘kmerCounts’]

See also

countRefKmer

Examples

>>> from errorCount import counter
>>> errorCounter = counter(ref,samfile)
>>> errorCounter.countErrorKmer(maxKmerLength = 3) 
>>> ## counts all possible kmers of length 1,2,3 before and after an error. 
>>> ({'A': {'C': 113, 'T': 105, 'G': 84}, ...}, {'after':{'A': {'C': {'CTT': 2, 'GCA': 1,...},..}} ,'before:{'A': {'C': {'CTT': 2, 'GCA': 1,...},..}}'})
countRefKmer(maxKmerLength=None)[source]¶

Count all kmers in the reference of length kmerLen or below

i.e. counter.countRefKmer(maxKmerLength = 3) counts all possible kmers of length 1,2,3

returns a dictonary of counts in the form

{‘AAT’:123,’AA’:123,...}

This dictonary is also stored in the counter object in counter.res[‘RefCounts’]

getCount(truth=None, emission=None, kmer='', after=False)[source]¶

Gets the count for a given {truth,emmision,kmer}

kmerFreq(seq, kmer)[source]¶

Calculate the number of times a kmer appears in a sequence seq : SeqRecord Object kmer : kmer string

readDiff(read, ref)[source]¶

Setup output

class proto_err.errorCount.error(true, emission, read, readPos)[source]¶

Information about the errors in a read

Methods

after(j)[source]¶

Return the following j bases,return N when bases missing e.g. error.after(2) returns the 2 bases after the error

before(j)[source]¶

Return the preceding j bases,return N when bases missing e.g. error.before(2) returns the 2 bases before the error ‘’

errorType None[source]¶

The type of read error SNP, Insertion or Deletion

isDeletion None[source]¶

Is the error a deletion

isIndel None[source]¶

Is the error an INDEL

isInsertion None[source]¶

Is the error an insertion

isSnp None[source]¶

Is the error a SNP

qscore(i)[source]¶

Return the quality score at a base +i i from the error start position error.qscore(0) is equivalent to error.qual

qual None[source]¶

Quality score of the base where the error occured. equivalent to error.qscore(0)

class proto_err.errorCount.errorReader(samfile, ref)[source]¶

Checks Deletionread segment for errors. called when cigarstring = D:N
